level.heading: ENFORCEMENT OF PERSONAL PROPERTY TAXES BY ACQUISITION OF LIEN

placeholder.heading: Examinations of books and persons; failure to obey summons or produce books; prosecutions.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-212
level.text: Law 6-212, the "Personal Property Tax Amendment Act of 1986," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-100, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 25, 1986 and December 16, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 8, 1987, it was assigned Act No. 6-272 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 410(e) of D.C. Law 13-305 provided: "Section 406(b), (d), (f), (l), (n), (o), (r), (v), (x)through (aa), (cc), (ff), (gg), (ll), (pp), (vv), (ww), (aaa), (ccc), (eee), and (ggg) shall apply as of January 1, 2001."

placeholder.heading: Distraint of personal property - Authority to levy and sell; report and audit; disposition of surplus.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-212
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-212, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 47-1701.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 7-104
level.text: Law 7-104, the "Technical Amendments Act of 1987," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-346, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 24, 1987, and December 8, 1987, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 1987, it was assigned Act No. 7-124 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Cross References
level.text: Prisons, industrial work programs, taxable income, see § 24-231.11.
Relocation assistance, taxation of relocation and housing assistance payments, see § 42-3403.05.
